item.title: RS model viewer β pics
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

jme_009:

Jumping int 3dsmax would be a little bit hard, unless you find a really good tutorial. But with most of these modelling programs they are not very “teach yourself” type of programs. Just read a few tutorials and then everything should make some more sense ;D

Eh, all programs are teach yourself programs, because chances anyone else can teach you well…slim.
I ended up with Max because I was going to learn how to do modelling back when Tamriel Rebuilt was a fun new idea (years ago) and it’s the only one that supported Bethesda’s NIF exporter. I’ll take a look at anim8or and some tutorial type stuff though. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: RS model viewer β pics
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:73, topic:3000”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=3400.msg38978#msg38978 date=1148758967]

wicked, do u mean normal maps

99.9% of all models for games are triangles when exported, due to they move better since more connections between verts and they load faster

Normal maps are almost like bump maps, and they don’t use anything like that, to my knowledge.

I don’t get why it would load faster either, triangulate a quad mesh and you get nearly double poly counts -_-

Personally, I HATE triangles.
[/quote]

Normal maps are of a highpoly model put onto low poly
used for lighting purposes

anyway yes u use triangles in games for they render easier for the engine itself and less calculations for the engine to do[/quote]

I know what they are, but that’s not what he was saying. I thought he said they had two models, one was invisible. The texture map is projected onto the lowpoly model, which is used on the highpoly to make it react better.

Read full topic

99.9% of all models for games are triangles when exported, due to they move better since more connections between verts and they load faster

Normal maps are almost like bump maps, and they don’t use anything like that, to my knowledge.

I don’t get why it would load faster either, triangulate a quad mesh and you get nearly double poly counts -_-

Personally, I HATE triangles.[/quote]

used for lighting purposes

anyway yes u use triangles in games for they render easier for the engine itself and less calculations for the engine to do

item.title: RS model viewer β pics
item.dc:creator: @MrWicked MrWicked
item.description:
@MrWicked wrote:

I found 3ds max pretty simple to pick up after a few days of fucking around haha, but if you really wanna learn to get started with 3d modeling, try www.anim8or.com Amazing free modelling program, super easy interface and it may not look like it could create amazing stuff i created a pretty sweet Alfa Romero and a Head that almost looks like spawn.

item.title: RS model viewer β pics
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

And triangles are also bitches to get out -_-

Kinda like obfusticating in a way.

Displacement maps > Bump/Normal maps

item.title: RS model viewer β pics
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Normal/Bump mapping looks so awesome, Project offset really knows how to use them. Runescape would never normal/bump map something though. But I sure wish blitz3d had support for it. It brings things to life.

Btw, Just build models as quads and then triangulate them, otherwise it’s like impossible to build things lol. But yeah my game uses all triangles, and when i talk about polygons i talk about triangles not quads.

Read full topic

item.title: RS model viewer β pics
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:58, topic:3000”]wicked, do u mean normal maps

99.9% of all models for games are triangles when exported, due to they move better since more connections between verts and they load faster[/quote]

Normal maps are almost like bump maps, and they don’t use anything like that, to my knowledge.

I don’t get why it would load faster either, triangulate a quad mesh and you get nearly double poly counts -_-

Personally, I HATE triangles.
